content: simple little scarf i work in my little shed shop in the summertime selling yarn and finished knitwear it s often too warm for heavy knits during the summer months while i am there but i find myself still wanting to wear knits to showcase the great selection of yarn i sell i created this pattern to have a cute little worsted weight neck scarf that goes with linen dresses or t-shirts without making me feel too hot i sized it to be similar to wearing a cotton bandana specifically i wanted to have this scarf work with one skein or less of the worsted weight yarns we carry malabrigo rios and worsted as well as baah shasta are great yarns for this pattern it s a simple pattern great for beginners the pattern is written for one size but can easily be made longer if desired i hope you enjoy knitting this little scarf what you ll need yarn worsted weight yarn weight 4 in one color uses less than 65-70g or about 135-150 yds 123-137 meters suggested yarns malabrigo worsted or rios needles us size 8 5 0 mm 16 or 24 40 5cm or 61cm circular knitting needles notions safety pin/hooking stitch markers optional yarn needle scissors details skill level beginner gauge 2x2 /5x5cm = 9 stitches x 14 row in stockinette stitch measurements finished scarf is 46 117cm long and 5 12 7cm at the widest point abbreviations co - cast on st s - stitch es k - knit yds - yards sl3pwyif - slip 3 sts purl wise with yarn in front ws - wrong side rs - right side m1l - make one left k2tog - knit 2 together simple little scarf | north road knits ©2026 | 2 policies this pattern and photos are property of jamie rex and may not be altered shared or sold do not rewrite any part of this design and sell as your own design you re welcome to sell finished products made with this pattern but please credit the design to me north road knits at www northroadknits com thank you contact me via northroadknits@gmail com if you have any questions if you are on instagram please use #simplelittlescarf and tag me @northroadknits so i can see what you make pattern notes this little scarf is knit from point to point there are simple increases every 8 row until you get to the middle row and simple decreases every 8 row on the way back down the other side i ve made the written length how i prefer it to fit a similar length to some of my favorite summer cotton bandana scarves you can choose to make your scarf longer if you d like to make your scarf as long as you can with a single skein of yarn simply weigh the skein beforehand and weigh the remaining yarn as you go beginning the decrease just before half of your yarn has been used up
